basics.name: Kenji Sanehira
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently studying computer science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I plan on graduating in May 2024 and I would like to apply my knowledge from school into the workforce. I enjoy working with others.

skills.name: Languages and Frameworks
keywords: UNIX, Java, C, HTML, CSS, Javascript, C++, HTML, CSS, Python, Meteor, MongoDB, underscoreJS, Bootstrap, AngularJS, LISP, OCAML, prolog

courses: International Thespian Society Social Media Manager
Currently Taking: ICS 313 (Programming Language Pragmatics) and ICS 321 (Database Systems)

work.summary: Team member on the UH Groupings Project
highlights: Work under Senior Developers and with fellow University of Hawaii students to develop the UH Groupings website.
Attend and present accomplishments and completed code for tickets picked up throughout the week.

work.summary: Assistant to the Set Building at CTAA
highlights: Supervise and instruct Central Theatre Arts Academy students on how to use different tools and machines in backstage theatre.
Assist Central Theatre Arts Academy instructors with developing a set for upcoming and ongoing plays/musicals.
Maintain a safe and encouraging work environment for students to learn all aspects of backstage theatre.

work.summary: Stage Manager for a summer production "Our Time " and "Newsies", Junior Counselor, and Program Assistant
highlights: Confer with technical directors, managers, and crew members to discuss aspects of production, such as set, costumes, lighting, sound, and choreography.
Send out emails and call parents regarding important information relevant to students.
Arranged and maintained schedules for rehearsals, costume fittings, and sound/light development.
Created flyers and advertisements for current shows and program activities.
Update the program website about student homework and upcoming activities.

volunteer.summary: Junior Leader for the Mililani District Park Summer Fun program.
highlights: Managing and supervising a group of children between the ages of 6-13 through day-to-day summer fun activities.
Assist a senior leader in planning the days out and ensuring the safety of the group of children in the program.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship is an automatic $2,000 scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first-time degree seeking students. Students must have a 3.5 GPA, 1200 SAT or 23 ACT upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: Thomas Tochiki Award
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence as a crew member by the Central Theatre Arts Academy throughout the course of multiple productions.
